alert.note: Alert for Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 3:25PM EDT until April 05 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN BARNWELL...SOUTHEASTERN AIKEN AND WESTERN ORANGEBURG COUNTIES... At 324 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near New Ellenton, or 9 miles southeast of Aiken Mall, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. Wall cloud reported at highway 19 and 278 near New Ellenton. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Williston around 335 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Aiken Gopher Tortoise Heritage Preserve, Windsor and Elko. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor of a sturdy building immediately.
